page.title: 11Children's Games-Marbles
page.content: by Samanatha Philips I have got 262 marbles of different colours, sizes and types. I like to play marbles and swap marbles. You can have different names for marbles, such as chinas, glasses, bottlewashers, ballbearings, peewis, pearlies, french chinas and kingfishers. You play marbles by rolling your marble along the floor or playground. Then the next person rolls their marble and tries to hit the other marble. If he or she does, then they win that marble. Sometimes we swap marbles. Two glass ones are worth one china one. But if you swap marbles watch out for the trickc, because some people take the tops of roll-on deodorant bottles and try to swap them.
